channel.title: Behance Network Featured Projects
channel.description: The latest projects featured on the Behance Network

item.title: P O W E R | 2 0 1 2
item.description: Artwork I did recently. I've wanted to do this piece for a long time, pretty much ever since i heard the song which i consider is probably Kanye's best purely because of it stands for. I tried to incorporate everything power stood for including the handmade font to symbolize old withered gold, and added some visuals from the video etc. and some ancient civilizations influence. "I've seen people use power abuse power misuse and then lose power". the reason why all civilizations eventually collapse, POWER. -------- Visually i knew to represent Power was not an easy feat. What Power meant to a Pharaoh or an Aztec king. to really understand Power you must go back the dawns of civilization and see where it all came from in the earliest of cultures. So i began looking at old typefaces the first ever languages and noticed the forms and structures and how they in themselves symbolized power in their history and influence. What is Power? is it a million people bowing at your feet and your name being remembered forever? Or is it knowing yourself and what your own capabilities are and how to use them to your best ability? ------- "NO ONE MAN SHOULD HAVE ALL THAT POWER".
item.content:encoded: Artwork I did recently. I've wanted to do this piece for a long time, pretty much ever since i heard the song which i consider is probably Kanye's best purely because of it stands for. I tried to incorporate everything power stood for including the handmade font to symbolize old withered gold, and added some visuals from the video etc. and some ancient civilizations influence. "I've seen people use power abuse power misuse and then lose power". the reason why all civilizations eventually collapse, POWER. -------- Visually i knew to represent Power was not an easy feat. What Power meant to a Pharaoh or an Aztec king. to really understand Power you must go back the dawns of civilization and see where it all came from in the earliest of cultures. So i began looking at old typefaces the first ever languages and noticed the forms and structures and how they in themselves symbolized power in their history and influence. What is Power? is it a million people bowing at your feet and your name being remembered forever? Or is it knowing yourself and what your own capabilities are and how to use them to your best ability? ------- "NO ONE MAN SHOULD HAVE ALL THAT POWER".

item.title: Red Cross - Our World Your Move
item.description: This is a 60" film I directed for the Red Cross campaign 'Our World Your Move' in 2009. First Prize Young Director Award 2009 by CFP-E/SHOTS at Cannes. music: Foals
item.content:encoded: This is a 60" film I directed for the Red Cross campaign 'Our World Your Move' in 2009. First Prize Young Director Award 2009 by CFP-E/SHOTS at Cannes. music: Foals

item.title: Theurel & Thomas
item.description: Theurel & Thomas is the first pâtisserie in Mexico specialized in French macarons, the most popular dessert of the French pastries. For this project it was very important to create an imposing brand that would emphasize the unique value, elegance and detail of this delicate dessert. White was our primary tool for design. As a result of this the attention was fully oriented to the colorful macarons. We placed two lines in our design in cyan and magenta, as a relation with a modern French flag to inject a vanguard vision to the identity. We selected Didot (created by Firmin and Pierre Didot), a French typography that would present the brand with sophistication. The Theurel & Thomas pâtisserie has an enlightened space with an exclusivity and elegant atmosphere. The store location is in San Pedro, Mexico, Latin America's most affluent suburb. White is a central part of the design and it contrasts with the French macarons colors. Details were an essential part of our work. We meticulously selected each porcelain piece creating a balance with sophisticated specks that made the value of the brand and the exclusivity of the product outshine. In this project we worked in collaboration with Roberto Treviño & German Deheza. To view more information for this project, visit this other project entry in our portfolio..
item.content:encoded: Theurel & Thomas is the first pâtisserie in Mexico specialized in French macarons, the most popular dessert of the French pastries. For this project it was very important to create an imposing brand that would emphasize the unique value, elegance and detail of this delicate dessert. White was our primary tool for design. As a result of this the attention was fully oriented to the colorful macarons. We placed two lines in our design in cyan and magenta, as a relation with a modern French flag to inject a vanguard vision to the identity. We selected Didot (created by Firmin and Pierre Didot), a French typography that would present the brand with sophistication. The Theurel & Thomas pâtisserie has an enlightened space with an exclusivity and elegant atmosphere. The store location is in San Pedro, Mexico, Latin America's most affluent suburb. White is a central part of the design and it contrasts with the French macarons colors. Details were an essential part of our work. We meticulously selected each porcelain piece creating a balance with sophisticated specks that made the value of the brand and the exclusivity of the product outshine. In this project we worked in collaboration with Roberto Treviño & German Deheza. To view more information for this project, visit this other project entry in our portfolio..

item.title: Boolean Taxidermy
item.description: Intelligent particles, the size of dust grains, are programmed to fill nonexistent shapes (the mathematical problem of geometry packing). The "know" their relative position inside the imaginary form (i.e. distance from hull or center) and take on a color relative to it.
item.content:encoded: Intelligent particles, the size of dust grains, are programmed to fill nonexistent shapes (the mathematical problem of geometry packing). The "know" their relative position inside the imaginary form (i.e. distance from hull or center) and take on a color relative to it.

item.title: CA Collection Typeface
item.description: Typeface designed exclusively for Computer Arts Collection available free with issue 2 based entirely on typography. The 48 page feature and studio profile follows our process when developing a display typeface from start to finish. Music packaging shown is fictional and created for the sole purpose of displaying the type.
item.content:encoded: Typeface designed exclusively for Computer Arts Collection available free with issue 2 based entirely on typography. The 48 page feature and studio profile follows our process when developing a display typeface from start to finish. Music packaging shown is fictional and created for the sole purpose of displaying the type.

item.title: The Weird Travels / DXTR & Friends
item.description: About the joy of traveling and great times with some of the most creative people and friends I met so far. The following photos show an excerpt of collaborative murals in Germany, Austria, England and Albania together with: Vidam, Look, QBRK, Nerd, Cone, Fr. Isa, Rookie, Nychos, Flying Förtress, Ghee, Morcky, Nero, The London Police, Ripo, Mr. Penfold and Mr. Gauky.
item.content:encoded: About the joy of traveling and great times with some of the most creative people and friends I met so far. The following photos show an excerpt of collaborative murals in Germany, Austria, England and Albania together with: Vidam, Look, QBRK, Nerd, Cone, Fr. Isa, Rookie, Nychos, Flying Förtress, Ghee, Morcky, Nero, The London Police, Ripo, Mr. Penfold and Mr. Gauky.

item.title: Sommelier Markov Anatoly
item.description: Personal identity for sommelier Markov Anatoly, a member of the Russian association of sommelier. In time of work process there has been made the compound sign including monogram MV (Markov Vin - fr.) and inscriptions, telling the information about sommelier. The wooden case-organizer is stylized as a wine box and it is marked suitably (a quantity of bottles, alcohol by volume, bottle volume, number of batch and IPPC mark). Set of the seals for independent manufacturing of business cards completes this kit (with date of manufacturing, like the date of pouring of wine) on textured paper and business cards holder, also executed from a natural tree.
item.content:encoded: Personal identity for sommelier Markov Anatoly, a member of the Russian association of sommelier. In time of work process there has been made the compound sign including monogram MV (Markov Vin - fr.) and inscriptions, telling the information about sommelier. The wooden case-organizer is stylized as a wine box and it is marked suitably (a quantity of bottles, alcohol by volume, bottle volume, number of batch and IPPC mark). Set of the seals for independent manufacturing of business cards completes this kit (with date of manufacturing, like the date of pouring of wine) on textured paper and business cards holder, also executed from a natural tree.

item.title: Sofia by Pelli Clarke Pelli Architects
item.description: Sofia is a building designed by architect Cesar Pelli for One Development Group. Located in San Pedro, Mexico, this building not only was designed by an internationally renowned architect, it also has the most generous specifications in every aspect: from automated appliances, to Leed certifications. Our task was to communicate such sophistication and exclusiveness to their potential buyers. Therefore we created an identity that was the exact opposite of what we usually see for this kind of project. Sofia's identity is formed by three very important axes: Logotype: the keys and the coat of arms are inspired by San Pedro's coat of arms. Typography: we developed a custom typeface designed especially for Sofia, it is inspired by british san serifs. Layout: the text and information arrangement is inspired by the typographical treatment used before grids were popularized by the swiss grid system. Both the attention to detail and the brand's elements convey the greatness of Sofia's architectural project.
item.content:encoded: Sofia is a building designed by architect Cesar Pelli for One Development Group. Located in San Pedro, Mexico, this building not only was designed by an internationally renowned architect, it also has the most generous specifications in every aspect: from automated appliances, to Leed certifications. Our task was to communicate such sophistication and exclusiveness to their potential buyers. Therefore we created an identity that was the exact opposite of what we usually see for this kind of project. Sofia's identity is formed by three very important axes: Logotype: the keys and the coat of arms are inspired by San Pedro's coat of arms. Typography: we developed a custom typeface designed especially for Sofia, it is inspired by british san serifs. Layout: the text and information arrangement is inspired by the typographical treatment used before grids were popularized by the swiss grid system. Both the attention to detail and the brand's elements convey the greatness of Sofia's architectural project.

item.title: SUMERU
item.description: Sumeru is a body of work that metaphorically illustrates the mental journey that is undertaken in Zen Buddhist training and practice. In Zen literature, the word land is commonly used as a symbol for the mind, and through a series of photographic montage images I have envisioned an exploration into the depths of this metaphorical mind-world. The narrative follows a spiritual quest as the storyline symbolically wanders through various states of consciousness and perceptions.
item.content:encoded: Sumeru is a body of work that metaphorically illustrates the mental journey that is undertaken in Zen Buddhist training and practice. In Zen literature, the word land is commonly used as a symbol for the mind, and through a series of photographic montage images I have envisioned an exploration into the depths of this metaphorical mind-world. The narrative follows a spiritual quest as the storyline symbolically wanders through various states of consciousness and perceptions.

item.title: LONDONS
item.description: Londons is a instilational piece made for the Samsung UK flagship store in Westfields Shopping Centre. We were commissioned to design and create a vast 5.5m by 2.5m mural which would be the base for 3 of their brand new near edgeless TV's, within which we animated part of the image which fell within the screens. The result is the effect of the TV's bringing the image to life. Londons creates 2 worlds apart in the same city. Based in a near future the project explores the development of the 'hyper capital' and the suburban 'favelas'. Both exist to metophorically and stylistically oppose the other. Within the TV's we animated the buildings, foliage, wind farms and created weather changes, all of which added to the effect. The concepts explored in this piece are illustrative of a film project in development for 2012. Architectural photography by Simon Kennedy www.simonkennedy.net
item.content:encoded: Londons is a instilational piece made for the Samsung UK flagship store in Westfields Shopping Centre. We were commissioned to design and create a vast 5.5m by 2.5m mural which would be the base for 3 of their brand new near edgeless TV's, within which we animated part of the image which fell within the screens. The result is the effect of the TV's bringing the image to life. Londons creates 2 worlds apart in the same city. Based in a near future the project explores the development of the 'hyper capital' and the suburban 'favelas'. Both exist to metophorically and stylistically oppose the other. Within the TV's we animated the buildings, foliage, wind farms and created weather changes, all of which added to the effect. The concepts explored in this piece are illustrative of a film project in development for 2012. Architectural photography by Simon Kennedy www.simonkennedy.net

item.title: INTRO free font
item.description: What distinguishes the new Intro free font from FontFabric is the strongly expressed geometric makeup and structure. The basic letters of the Alphabet like A, O and H are built or based on principles of simple geometric forms triangles, circles and squares.
item.content:encoded: What distinguishes the new Intro free font from FontFabric is the strongly expressed geometric makeup and structure. The basic letters of the Alphabet like A, O and H are built or based on principles of simple geometric forms triangles, circles and squares.
